title: Privatising airports has brought gains. Here’s what needs to be done to make them high-yield assets.
text:
Almost 20 years down the line, the public-private partnership model for airports has brought significant upside for investors. While past biddings left much to be desired on response from bidders, the evolved PPP model has found a sweet spot, with aggressive participation. Translating this to viability will need transformational steps on multiplying non-aero revenues from passengers, non-passengers, and real estate.
